required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-Term Patient Satisfaction of Facial Aesthetic Treatment With BOTOX®

brief_summary.textblock: This is an observational study assessing patient satisfaction following at least 5 years of BOTOX® treatment for glabellar lines.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Mostly or Very Satisfied With Their Glabellar Lines on the Facial Line Satisfaction Questionnaire (FLSQ)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Study Day 1 (approximately 4-28 weeks following last treatment)
primary_outcome.description: Participants assessed their overall satisfaction with their glabellar lines by answering FLSQ Question 5: "How satisfied are you with the effect your treatment had on your facial lines?" using a 5-point scale where: -2=very dissatisfied, -1=mostly dissatisfied, 0=neither dissatisfied nor satisfied, 1=mostly satisfied and 2=very satisfied. The percentage of participants mostly or very satisfied is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Mostly or Very Satisfied With Effectiveness of ≥ 5 Years BOTOX® Treatments Using the Patient Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Day 1 (approximately 4-28 weeks following last treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants rated their overall satisfaction with BOTOX® treatment by answering the question on the Patient Reported Overall Satisfaction of Effectiveness Questionnaire: "You have received BOTOX® facial aesthetic treatment(s) for at least 5 years. How satisfied overall are you with the effect of BOTOX®?" using the following possible answers: Very Dissatisfied, Mostly Dissatisfied, Neither Satisfied or Dissatisfied, Mostly Satisfied or Very Satisfied. The percentage of participants who answered Mostly Satisfied or Very Satisfied is reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Where Physician Was Mostly or Very Satisfied With Effectiveness of ≥ 5 Years BOTOX® Treatments Using the Physician Questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Study Day 1 (approximately 4-28 weeks following last treatment)
secondary_outcome.description: Physicians rated their overall satisfaction with BOTOX® treatment by answering the question on the Physician Reported Overall Satisfaction of Effectiveness Questionnaire: "You have treated this patient with BOTOX® facial aesthetic treatment(s) for at least 5 years. How satisfied overall are you with the effect of BOTOX®?" using the following possible answers: Very Dissatisfied, Mostly Dissatisfied, Neither Satisfied or Dissatisfied, Mostly Satisfied or Very Satisfied. The percentage of participants where the physician answered Mostly Satisfied or Very Satisfied is reported.

arm_group.description: Botulinum toxin Type A (BOTOX®) treatment to glabellar lines as prescribed by the Investigator over at least 5 years.

intervention.description: botulinum toxin Type A (BOTOX®) treatment to glabellar lines as prescribed by the Investigator over at least 5 years.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects treated for at least 5 years with BOTOX® for glabellar lines

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- At least one BOTOX® treatment for facial wrinkles (glabellar lines) per calendar year for ≥5 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Received botulinum toxin formulations other than BOTOX®

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Eligible patients were identified by retrospective chart review. Demographic and Outcome Measure data were collected at a study visit on Day 1 (approximately 4-28 weeks following last treatment) for patients who received treatment with BOTOX® for ≥5 years. Adverse Event data was collected by retrospective chart review.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Botulinum toxin Type A (BOTOX®) treatment to glabellar lines as prescribed by the Investigator over a period of at least 5 years.

outcome.description: Participants assessed their overall satisfaction with their glabellar lines by answering FLSQ Question 5: “How satisfied are you with the effect your treatment had on your facial lines?” using a 5-point scale where: -2=very dissatisfied, -1=mostly dissatisfied, 0=neither dissatisfied nor satisfied, 1=mostly satisfied and 2=very satisfied. The percentage of participants mostly or very satisfied is reported.
outcome.time_frame: Study Day 1 (approximately 4-28 weeks following last treatment)
outcome.population: Per Protocol population included all enrolled participants who met eligibility criteria with data available for analysis.

reported_events.time_frame: The collection period was up to 17 years.
reported_events.desc: Adverse Event data was collected by retrospective chart review. Only treatment related adverse events were reported.

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Botulinum toxin Type A (BOTOX®) treatment to glabellar lines as prescribed by the Investigator over a period of at least 5 years.

event.description: Includes lip and mouth asymmetry and brow ptosis.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: A disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 90 days from the time submitted to the sponsor for review. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
